channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Massey police shooting: Second fugitive captured, murder accused in court
item.description: A woman being hunted after the fatal shooting of a police officer has been arrested in West Auckland, while a man charged with the murder of Constable Matthew Hunt appeared in court earlier today.

item.title: The good and bad of alcohol: 'It's not simple for everyone'
item.description: The normalisation of alcohol in virtually every setting and the advertising pitch that it's glamorous is causing damage, says author Lotta Dann.

item.title: Sir Peter Jackson pays tribute to Sir Ian Holm who played Bilbo Baggins
item.description: Sir Peter Jackson has paid tribute to actor Sir Ian Holm, who played Bilbo Baggins in The Lord of the Rings films describing him as a delightful, generous man.

item.title: Former US police chief who rebuilt his dept: Change or be changed
item.description: A former police chief who led a major reform of what was then America's most violent city says police must shift their thinking and change - or find themselves changed regardless.

item.title: Third shooting in Auckland in 24 hours
item.description: There has been a third shooting in Auckland in less than 24 hours.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand
item.description: A couple who have returned to New Zealand from India and were in isolation have tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: The power of touch in a socially distant world
item.description: A survey into how people dealt without physical contact during lockdown has found that most felt deprived of touch, and that can lead to a raft of health problems including depression and anxiety.

item.title: World Refugee Day: 'I am indebted to help, because NZ helped me'
item.description: Opinion - Former refugee Merhawi Woldemichael settled in Wellington 12 years ago today - on World Refugee Day - and says that day was a bridge between different lives.

item.title: Hotel residents concerned over reports of quarantined travellers arriving
item.description: News that busloads of people are going into quarantine at an Auckland hotel today has residents in the building worried, but authorities say no decision yet has been made on using the hotel.

item.title: Damp Christchurch social housing complex finally gets ventilation
item.description: More than 50 Christchurch residents living in mouldy and damp social housing finally have warmer homes this winter.

item.title: Police name slain officer as Constable Matthew Dennis Hunt
item.description: Hunt, 28, had a criminology degree and was "a person of great integrity" whose dream was to be a police officer, his family says.

item.title: Bus crashes into house in Auckland suburb
item.description: No one has been seriously injured after a bus crashed into a house in the Auckland suburb of New Lynn this morning.

item.title: Police locate woman wanted after yesterday's fatal police shooting
item.description: Auckland police have arrested the 30-year-old woman wanted in connection to the fatal shooting of a police officer in Massey yesterday.

item.title: Tighter rules at Tauranga Port for foreign boat arrivals
item.description: Tauranga health authorities have clamped down on sailors entering the country after a horror week for the government on pandemic border controls, but Auckland is holding off.

item.title: Name suppression for man charged with murder of police officer
item.description: A 24-year-old man has been granted interim name suppression after appearing in an Auckland court via video link today, charged with murder over the shooting of a police officer.

item.title: Rainbow communities human rights report targets six failures in New Zealand
item.description: Omissions in the Human Rights Act and lack of official data is preventing access to basic rights for many in rainbow communities, a Human Rights Commisssion report has found.

item.title: Rare protected falcon shot dead in Gisborne
item.description: The Department of Conservation is investigating after a kÄrearea was shot dead in central Gisborne.

item.title: Border restrictions eased for sportspeople, infrastructure project workers
item.description: Participants in more than a dozen sporting events and workers in 60 infrastructure projects can now qualify to fly into New Zealand.
